1105.title: Relating To Conservation District Permits.
1105.description: Specifies that, for purposes of emergency permits to alleviate coastal erosion in a conservation district, a land use shall be considered to be immediately threatened by coastal erosion that occurs within forty feet of the land use or that will threaten any structure in less than six months.

1106.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).

1106.description: Establishes a task force to examine and make recommendations on policy issues regarding the benefits and harms of online gaming. (HB1107 HD1)

1109.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1109.title: Relating To Flood Mitigation.
1109.description: Establishes a task force within the Department of Land and Natural Resources to research and make recommendations on how to mitigate flooding in Manoa Valley. Requires a report to the Legislature and the Honolulu City Council.

1110.last_action: Referred to WLH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1110.title: Relating To Conservation Districts.
1110.description: Requires the cancellation or expiration of conservation district use permits in certain circumstances.

1114.last_action: Referred to LHE/WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1114.title: Relating To Hawaiian Language Education.
1114.description: Requires the Department of Education to teach Hawaiian language to students in each public elementary school.

1116.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, DeCoite, Nakamura, Quinlan, Thielen excused (5).
1116.title: Relating To State Lands.
1116.description: Requires the Board of Agriculture and the Agribusiness Development Corporation to ensure the timely collection of lease payments, track lessees that are in arrears of lease payments, and offer payment plans for lessees in arears. Authorizes the BLNR to allow payment plans for a breach or default of a lease or patent. Prohibits land leased by the Agribusiness Development Corporation from being assigned or sublet without Corporation approval. (HB1117 HD2)

1117.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 6
1117.title: Relating To Environmental Sustainability.
1117.description: Establishes a reusable utensil pilot project in Department of Education schools on Molokai. Requires the Department of Education to report to the legislature on the feasibility of statewide implementation. Appropriates funds.

1118.last_action: Re-referred to TIA, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 10
1118.title: Relating To State Holidays.
1118.description: Reestablishes La Kuokoa, Hawaiian Recognition Day, as an official state holiday.

1119.title: Relating To The Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Fiftieth Representative District.
1119.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 50th Representative District.

1120.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1120.title: Relating To Water Security.
1120.description: Requires the Commission on Water Resource Management to conduct an update of the statewide framework for the Hawaii water plan to provide guidance for Hawaii's future water plan. Makes an appropriation. Takes effect 12/31/2050. (SD1)

1127.last_action: Referred to HSH/HSG, FIN, referral sheet 6

1127.description: Requires the Department of Human Services to establish, construct, and operate a transitional shelter comprising micro units beneath the Nimitz Viaduct or other areas on the island of Oahu, and to submit a report on the establishment of the transitional shelter to the Legislature. Makes an appropriation.

1128.last_action: Referred to HSH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1128.title: Relating To The Homeless.
1128.description: Assists the homeless in reuniting with family in their home states. Appropriates funds.

1129.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1129.title: Relating To Unclaimed Property.
1129.description: Requires unclaimed property valued under $100 to be automatically transferred into the general funds of the State.

1130.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6

1130.description: Requires the department of land and natural resources to provide administrative support to the council. Requires that the chairperson be selected by the members on an annual and rotating basis. Requires the council to meet quarterly.

1133.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1133.title: Relating To Forestry Budget Requests And Development Projects.
1133.description: Amends positions and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects related to Department of Land and Natural Resources, Division of Forestry and Wildlife.

1134.title: Relating To Department Of Taxation Operations.
1134.description: Provides funding for the operations of the Department of Taxation for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2019, and ending June 30, 2021. (HB1135 HD1)

1136.title: Relating To The Department Of Taxation.
1136.description: Short form bill relating to the Department of Taxation.

1137.title: Relating To The Department Of Budget And Finance.
1137.description: Short form bill relating to the Department of Budget and Finance.

1139.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-ninth Representative District.
1139.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 49th Representative District.

1142.title: Relating To Teacher Salaries.
1142.description: Requires that teachers teaching at hard-to-staff schools be paid the national average of a similarly situated teacher, with annual cost of living adjustments, or according to the teacher's salary schedule. Requires teachers who are paid the national average to forego any pay differential. (HB1143 HD2)

1144.last_action: Referred to HSH/HLT, FIN, referral sheet 6
1144.title: Relating To Grant In Aid.
1144.description: Requires the Department of Human Services and the Department of Health to disperse grant-in-aid funds to recipient organizations within ninety days of the effective date of the legislation awarding the grant. Allows the Department of Human Services and the Department of Health to disperse the total amount awarded to recipient organizations before contract execution.

1145.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 04-26-19 1:00PM in conference room 325.
1145.title: Relating To Procurement.
1145.description: Requires procurement officers to complete past performance evaluations of contractors. Requires past performance to be considered in all sole source procurement and any competitive contracts that exceeds the small purchase threshold. Establishes an initial procurement working group that will evaluate and make recommendations to the legislature about the effectiveness of existing procurement methods. Requires the development and implementation of a statewide past performance database. Appropriates funds. Effective 1/1/2050. (SD1)

1146.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).
1146.title: Relating To Intimate Partner Violence.
1146.description: Requires barber, beauty operator, and instructor licensees under the Board of Barbering and Cosmetology to complete a one-time, one-hour training program on intimate partner violence awareness and education, which may be administered electronically. (HB1147 HD1)

1147.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1147.title: Relating To Health Care Coverage.
1147.description: Prohibits health insurers and like entities from making changes to policies or contracts prior to their renewal.

1148.title: Relating To On-site Childhood Facilities.
1148.description: Establishes an income tax credit for employers who create on-site early childhood facilities. Establishes and appropriates funds for one on-site Early Childhood Facility Coordinator position.

1149.last_action: Referred to PVM, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1149.title: Making Appropriations For The Veterans Treatment Court.
1149.description: Appropriates funds to the Judiciary and the Prosecuting Attorney of the City and County of Honolulu to support the Veterans Treatment Court.

1150.last_action: The committee on WTL deferred the measure.
1150.title: Relating To Commercial Ocean Recreation.
1150.description: Requires the Department of Land and Natural Resources to adopt rules pursuant to Chapter 91, HRS, to require certain safety measures for commercial ocean operators that take customers into state waters for activities such as snorkeling, scuba diving, kayaking, and surfing lessons. (HB1151 HD1)

1152.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1152.title: Relating To Remote Testimony In Legislative Hearings.
1152.description: Establishes the remote legislative access program, to be supervised by the joint legislative access committee. Specific requirements that the joint legislative access committee must consider when developing the program. Requires each house of the Legislature to establish, by rule, procedures for the public to present oral testimony at legislative committee hearings through remote testimony. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2022. (SD1)

1153.title: Relating To The Owner-builder Exemption.
1153.description: Requires owner-builders to provide proof of withholding taxes and workers' compensation insurance. Amends fines for failure to comply with statute. (HB1154 HD1)

1155.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).

1155.description: Establishes the broadband service infrastructure grant program to award grants to applicants to extend deployment of facilities used to provide broadband service to unserved and underserved areas of the State. Makes an appropriation. (HB1156 HD1)

1156.description: Exempts students in post-secondary education programs from immunization requirements if they attend classes exclusively online or through distance learning, under certain conditions. (HB1157 CD1)

1157.last_action: Referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 6
1157.title: Relating To County Sidewalks.
1157.description: Requires that any county-owned street along which are six or more homes include one or more sidewalks. Provides grants-in-aid to the counties for the purpose of building sidewalks along existing county-owned streets.

1158.last_action: Re-referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 10
1158.title: Relating To Retail Wheeling.
1158.description: Requires the public utilities commission to establish policies and procedures related to retail wheeling to enable independent power producers to sell electricity directly to end users.

1159.last_action: Referred to WLH, JUD, referral sheet 6
1159.title: Relating To Shooting Range Protection.
1159.description: Provides protections to shooting range operators and individuals engaged in target shooting from burdensome regulations related to noise pollution and similar noise control ordinances.

1160.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1160.title: Relating To Internet Crimes Against Children.
1160.description: Appropriates funds for the establishment of four full-time equivalent (4.0 FTE) permanent level 5 investigators and three full-time equivalent (3.0 FTE) permanent investigative analyst positions within the Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force in the Department of the Attorney General.

1161.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1161.title: Relating To Pet Boarding Facilities.
1161.description: Regulates the operation of pet boarding facilities within the State. (HB1162 HD1)

1162.title: Relating To Savings Promotion Contests.
1162.description: Authorizes a financial institution that is a depository institution to conduct savings promotion or prizelinked savings contests in which its account holders are contestants. (HB1163 CD1)

1163.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, Nakamura excused (2).
1163.title: Relating To Deferred Maintenance.
1163.description: Establishes a deferred maintenance task force within the Office of the Governor to create a standardized and uniform approach to address deferred maintenance projects in the State. Makes an appropriation for the task force. (HB1164 HD1)

1164.description: Requires a license or state identification card to include a person's full legal name, date of birth, gender designation, residence address, and license number. Specifies gender designation options of F, M, or X. Effective 7/1/2020. (SD2)

1166.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 6
1166.title: Relating To Department Of Education Carryover Funds.
1166.description: Repeals authorization for the Department of Education to carry over excess funds.

1168.title: Relating To The Barrel Tax.
1168.description: Short form bill relating to the barrel tax.

1171.last_action: The committee on CPH deferred the measure.
1171.title: Relating To Liquor Laws.
1171.description: Repeals requirement that there be attached a clear and legible notice, placard, or marker upon the faucet, spigot, or outlet wherefrom the draught beer is drawn. Requires rules adopted by the counties related to stacking of beer to refer to a standard serving of total volume that shall not exceed thirty-two ounces of total volume before a customer at any one time. (HB1172 HD1)

1174.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirty-fourth Representative District.
1174.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 34th Representative District.

1175.description: Authorizes law enforcement officers of the Department of Transportation to use electric guns while performing their duties. Requires law enforcement officers of DOT to be accredited by June 30, 2024, for the use of electric guns. (SD1)

1177.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1177.title: Relating To The Fiscal Biennium 2019-2021 Budget Requests For The Department Of Land And Natural Resources.
1177.description: Appropriates funds for Department of Land and Natural Resources budget items. (SD1)

1178.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Fourth Representative District.
1178.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 4th Representative District.

1179.title: Relating To Natural Disasters.
1179.description: Appropriates funds for disaster relief, recovery, mitigation, and remediation activities for the County of Hawaii. Requires reporting of monthly expenditures to the Department of Budget and Finance. (HB1180 HD1)

1181.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 6
1181.title: Relating To Vaccinations And Conscientious Objectors.
1181.description: Authorizes conscientious beliefs as a basis for exemption from vaccination and immunization requirements. Authorizes licensed naturopathic physicians to certify exemption from immunization requirements. Requires that the first option for quarantine of an individual be quarantined inside that individual's residence.

1182.last_action: Referred to TRN, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1182.title: Relating To Autonomous Motor Vehicles.
1182.description: Authorizes for testing purposes the operation of autonomous vehicles in the State of Hawaii. Requires Department of Transportation to establish an application and approval process and report annually to the legislature. Makes an appropriation.

1183.last_action: The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be HELD. The votes were as follows: 6 Ayes: Representative(s) Mizuno, B. Kobayashi, Belatti, San Buenaventura, Say, Tokioka; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Ward; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Nakamura.
1183.title: Relating To Born Alive Infants.
1183.description: Ensures the protection and promotion of the health and well being of all infants born alive the State. Mandates medically appropriate and reasonable life-saving and life-sustaining medical care and treatment to all born alive infants. Provides civil and criminal penalties.

1184.last_action: Referred to EDB/LAB, FIN, referral sheet 6
1184.title: Relating To Artificial Intelligence Task Force.
1184.description: Creates a legislative task force to investigate the application and the accompanying advantages and disadvantages of applying artificial intelligence to Hawaii's economy and government operations.

1187.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Thursday 04-25-19 3:15PM in conference room 423.
1187.title: Relating To The State Procurement Office.
1187.description: Appropriates funds for fiscal year 2019-2020 to the State Procurement Office to advance the Small Business Assistance Initiative established by Act 42, Session Laws of Hawaii 2017. Effective 1/1/2061. (SD1)

1191.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 948).
1191.title: Relating To Equal Pay.
1191.description: Conforms statutory prohibitions against wage discrimination with other prohibitions on employment discrimination. Clarifies allowable justifications for compensation differentials and remedies for pay disparity. Requires employers to disclose wage ranges to employees and prospective employees. (SD2)

1193.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Eleventh Representative District.
1193.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 11th Representative District.

1194.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
1194.title: Relating To Federal Workers.
1194.description: Establishes the Federal Furlough Loan Program to provide loans to eligible federal workers affected by the federal shutdown furlough. Provides an emergency appropriation to carry out the purposes of the loan program. (HB1195 HD1)

1195.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakamura, Thielen excused (2).
1195.title: Relating To Civil Service.
1195.description: Exempts non-elected chief executive officers or heads of the executive branch of county government from the civil service laws. (HB1196 HD1)

1197.title: Relating To Statewide Liquor Laws.
1197.description: Requires uniform standard operating procedures for all county liquor agencies. Allows the consumption of alcohol on a manufacturer, wholesale dealer, or retail dealer licensee's premises.

1198.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Sixth Representative District.
1198.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 6th Representative District.

1199.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 6
1199.title: Relating To Employment.
1199.description: Amends the definition of "employer" in chapter 388, HRS, to include the State and counties when a provision in that chapter has no comparable provision in chapter 78, HRS.

1201.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The First Representative District.
1201.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 1st Representative District.

1204.last_action: Referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1204.title: Relating To Solar Energy Devices.
1204.description: Amends the definition of "solar energy devices" to include building-applied photovoltaics and building-integrated photovoltaics and clarify that the term excludes passive solar skylights or windows.

1206.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-fourth Representative District.
1206.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 24th Representative District.

1209.description: Adds unlicensed sale of liquor as an offense for which property is subject to forfeiture and increases the grade of the offense to a class C felony. Provides an affirmative defense. Amends definitions of "organized crime" and "racketeering activity" to include the unlicensed sale of liquor.

1211.last_action: Referred to HSG/TRN, WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1211.title: Relating To Transit-oriented Development.
1211.description: Establishes Transit-Oriented Development Community Districts within the Hawaii Community Development Authority along certain rail stations in the Honolulu rail transit corridor. Allows HCDA to enter into public-private partnerships and lease-back agreements for public infrastructure development.

1219.last_action: Re-referred to TIA, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 10
1219.title: Relating To Time Sharing Plans.
1219.description: Eliminates the requirement that a time share developer (1) file copies of all encumbrances affecting title to all time share units in a time share plan as part of the registration process; and (2) include in the time share disclosure statement a list all encumbrances affecting title to all time share units in a time share plan. Requires that a time share disclosure statement include a description of the condominium documents only for those time share plans where the time share owners are actually unit owners either in fee or to the extent and for the purposes provided in a recorded unit lease. Permits the developer to make ministerial updates to the disclosure statement on an expedited basis.

1221.last_action: Referred to HLT/HSH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1221.title: Relating To Adult Residential Care Homes.
1221.description: Requires the Department of Health to provide training to applicable adult residential care homes and extended care adult residential care homes personnel on the use of required reporting software

1224.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on IAC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).
1224.title: Relating To Child Care Homes.
1224.description: Establishes the certification and other requirements (including permitted advertising, programs, caregiver requirements, caregiver-child ratio, and number of supervised children) for family child care homes and group child care homes. Allows group child care homes in residential and agricultural areas. (HB1225 HD1)

1226.last_action: Referred to LHE, JUD, referral sheet 6
1226.title: Relating To Free Speech.
1226.description: Requires each campus of the University of Hawaii to establish a free speech policy that includes a process for students to report alleged violations of free speech rights. Requires the policy to be disseminated to certain employees and be included in the campus's student handbook, student orientation program, and website. Requires annual report summarizing any complaints alleging violation of free speech rights.

1229.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 6
1229.title: Relating To Pickup Trucks.
1229.description: Authorizes a county to adopt rules or ordinances that place stricter limitations on a passenger seated in the bed or load-carrying area of a pickup truck while the vehicle is in operation.

1230.last_action: Referred to LHE, TIA, FIN, referral sheet 6
1230.title: Relating To International Education Programs.
1230.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii to fund one or more programs sponsored or organized by a University of Hawaii community college or a four-year campus to expand opportunities for international college experiences for University of Hawaii students. Requires the University of Hawaii to work in collaboration with the department of business, economic development, and tourism and requires a report to be submitted to the legislature.

1231.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Eighth Representative District.
1231.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 8th Representative District.

1232.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 6
1232.title: Relating To Personal Injury Protection Benefits.
1232.description: Increases maximum limit for personal injury protection coverage. Expands personal injury protection benefits to include services that are included in calculating medical expense deductions under the United States Internal Revenue Code, including necessary travel to receive medical treatment.

1234.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 6
1234.title: Relating To Pedestrian Safety.
1234.description: Directs the Department of Education to require each student from kindergarten through grade 12 to take a pedestrian-safety course annually.

1235.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1235.title: Relating To Makua Valley.
1235.description: Establishes a Makua Valley Task Force to prepare for the transition of the Makua Military Reservation from the United States Army upon the expiration of the Army's lease for the land.

1237.last_action: Referred to HSH, JUD, referral sheet 6
1237.title: Relating To Parental Rights.
1237.description: Requires the family court to terminate parental rights if the court determines, by clear and convincing evidence, that a natural parent committed sexual assault of the other natural parent; the child was conceived as a result of the sexual assault by the parent; and termination of parental rights is in the best interests of the child, under certain conditions. Requires the family court to suspend custody and visitation, after proper filing of a petition and a hearing, to any child whose parent or legal guardian is charged for a sexual assault or other offense, under certain conditions.

1238.last_action: Referred to TRN, FIN, referral sheet 6
1238.title: Making An Appropriation To The Department Of The Transportation To Replace Jersey Barriers Fronting The Department Of Transportation Harbors Division Building On South Nimitz Highway.
1238.description: Appropriates $192,000 to the Department of Transportation to replace jersey barriers fronting the Harbors Division building on South Nimitz Highway.

1239.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1239.title: Related To Mental Health Treatment.
1239.description: Requires an individual to be examined prior to release from emergency examination, emergency hospitalization, or voluntary inpatient treatment to determine whether an assisted community plan is indicated and, if so, requires the department of the attorney general to handle the petition for assisted community treatment. Requires the department of health to convene a mental health emergencies task force. Makes the department of the attorney general responsible for filing assisted community treatment petitions.

1240.title: Relating To Use Tax.
1240.description: Requires individuals to report use tax liabilities on their individual income tax return and remit payments of the use tax with their individual income tax returns, if applicable, or report use tax liabilities on use tax returns and remit payments with the returns. Applies to taxable years beginning after 12/31/19.

1243.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).
1243.title: Relating To Rental Discrimination.
1243.description: Prohibits housing discrimination in rental transactions, including in advertisements for available rental units, on the basis of a renter's participation in a housing assistance program or the requirements of a housing assistance program. (HB1244 HD1)

1245.title: Relating To Trespass.
1245.description: Specifies that for purposes of making a complaint for criminal trespass in the second degree on commercial premises, evidence of a prior reasonable warning or request to leave the premises may be evidenced by a copy of the previously issued written warning or request, whether posted at the premises or retained by the county police department. (HB1246 HD1)

1246.last_action: Referred to PVM, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1246.title: Relating To Law Enforcement.
1246.description: Prohibits state and county law enforcement agencies from complying with federal immigration detainers or honoring requests for non-public information unless specifically required to do so by a warrant signed by a judge or provisions of federal, state, or local law.

1248.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 6
1248.title: Relating To Emergency Response Vehicles.
1248.description: Establishes an emergency response vehicle noise task force to determine the impact of emergency response vehicle sirens in terms of excessive noise, the effect on public safety, and the relative effectiveness of the use of emergency lights instead of the use of sirens at night.

1249.last_action: Referred to LMG, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1249.title: Relating To Legal Representation.
1249.description: Clarifies that the attorney general shall not represent the legislature and individual legislators acting in their official capacity. Requires the respective house to provide legal representation for any member who is sued in the member's official capacity unless the member declines such representation.

1250.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1250.title: Relating To Corporations.
1250.description: Requires domestic and foreign corporations to provide their shareholders with reports of independent expenditures and political contributions.

1253.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 6
1253.title: Relating To Vessels.
1253.description: Authorizes the director of transportation to adopt rules that regulate and limit noise from vessels at harbors, ports, roadsteads, docks, wharves, piers, quays, bulkheads, and landings of the State.

1254.last_action: Referred to WLH, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1254.title: Relating To State Water Code Penalties.
1254.description: Adds a minimum penalty of $50 per violation of the state water code and makes each day that a violation exists or continues a separate offense. Requires the Commission on Water Resource Management to determine the amount of the penalty based on the circumstances of the violation.

1255.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 6
1255.title: Relating To Crosswalk Safety.
1255.description: Clarifies the requirement that a driver of a motor vehicle yield to or stop for a pedestrian by specifying when a pedestrian is considered to be within an intersection or adjacent crosswalk or crossing the roadway within a crosswalk.

1258.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects.
1258.description: Appropriates capital improvement projects for fiscal biennium 20192021.

1259.last_action: The committee(s) on LAB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1259.title: Relating To Employees' Retirement System.
1259.description: Reduces, for members who join the Employees' Retirement System after June 20, 2019, and have credited service as a judge, the retirement allowance for each year of credited service as a judge from 3% to 2 1/4% of the member's average final compensation.

1260.title: Related To Judicial Proceedings.
1260.description: Makes permanent the requirement that decisions in contested case hearings of the Commission on Water Resource Management, Land Use Commission, Public Utilities Commission, Hawaii Community Development Authority, and those involving conservation districts be appealed directly to the Supreme Court, with certain exceptions. Takes effect on June 30, 2019. (SD1)

1261.last_action: Referred to EEP, LAB, FIN, referral sheet 6
1261.title: Relating To Solar Energy.
1261.description: Permits the governing body of a county to create, by ordinance, a process for the recordation and enforcement of solar easements. Allows counties to require individuals claiming a solar right to record that right by filing a declaration with the county clerk. Permits the governing body of a county to require, by ordinance, the trimming of vegetation that blocks solar radiation from solar energy devices. Authorizes the ordinance to include a designation for the cost of trimming.

1262.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1262.title: Relating To Order Of Succession.
1262.description: Amends the order of succession to the office of lieutenant governor. (SD1)

1264.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1264.title: Relating To Parentage.
1264.description: Clarifies that evidence demonstrating an alleged parent's non-consent to an artificial insemination procedure that resulted in the birth of a child may be introduced as evidence relating to paternity.

1265.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twenty-sixth Representative District.
1265.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 26th Representative District.

1267.title: Relating To Statutory Revision: Amending Or Repealing Various Provisions Of The Hawaii Revised Statutes And The Session Laws Of Hawaii For The Purposes Of Correcting Errors And References, Clarifying Language, And Deleting Obsolete Or Unnecessary Provisions.
1267.description: Amends or repeals various provisions of the Hawaii Revised Statutes and the Session Laws of Hawaii for the purposes of correcting errors and references, clarifying language, and deleting obsolete or unnecessary provisions. (SD1)

1268.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1268.title: Relating To Autism Spectrum Disorders.
1268.description: Clarifies the professionals who may administer autism treatment under mandated insurance coverage establish by Luke's Law.

1277.title: Relating To Government Services Relating To The Law.
1277.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of programs of various agencies under the purview of the House of Representatives Standing Committee on Judiciary. (HB1278 HD2)

1278.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
1278.title: Relating To The Oversight Of Election Activities.
1278.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Campaign Spending Commission and Office of Elections under the purview of the House of Representatives Standing Committee on Judiciary. (HB1279 HD1)

1279.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1279.title: Proposing An Amendment To The Hawaii Constitution, Article Ii, Section 1, To Expand The Right To Vote.
1279.description: Lowers the right to vote in state and local elections to those who are sixteen years of age or older per the Hawaii Constitution.

1281.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, Nakamura excused (2).
1281.title: Relating To State Building Construction.
1281.description: Requires all state building construction that uses concrete to use post-industrial carbon dioxide mineralized concrete unless use of these materials will increase costs or delay construction. (HB1282 HD1)

1282.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1282.title: Relating To Financial Security.
1282.description: Requires certain mortgages or automobile loans of at least $1000 to include an option for the borrower to miss a monthly payment without penalty.

1283.last_action: Re-referred to HLT, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 17
1283.title: Relating To Public Health.
1283.description: Limits the State's preemption of local ordinances that regulate the sale of cigarettes, tobacco products, and electronic smoking devices to allow the counties to enact ordinances more protective of public health than state law. (HB1284 HD1)

1286.last_action: Referred to EEP, FIN, referral sheet 6
1286.title: Relating To A Carbon Tax.
1286.description: Imposes a carbon tax for every ton of carbon dioxide emitted by distributors because of fossil fuels. Deposits 25% of the carbon tax collected into the Environmental Response Revolving Fund and 25% into the Energy Security Special Fund. Refunds 50% of the carbon tax amounts collected to taxpayers.

1287.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Twenty-first Representative District.
1287.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 21st Representative District.

1288.last_action: The committee on PSM deferred the measure.
1288.title: Relating To Criminal Pretrial Reform.
1288.description: Implements recommendations of the Criminal Pretrial Task Force convened pursuant to House Concurrent Resolution No. 134, House Draft 1, Regular Session of 2017. (HB1289 HD2)

1291.last_action: Referred to WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1291.title: Relating To The Payment Of Debt Service On The Turtle Bay Reimbursable General Obligation Bonds.
1291.description: Streamlines the process for payment of debt service on the reimbursable general obligation bonds for Turtle Bay by authorizing the Board of Land and Natural Resources to make direct payments from the Land Conservation Fund to the Turtle Bay Conservation Easement Special Fund.

1295.last_action: Referred to PVM, FIN, referral sheet 6
1295.title: Relating To Active Duty Military Entitlements.
1295.description: Requires the State to: pay, without delay, military personnel called to active duty at the same rate as their active duty counterparts; provide basic housing allowance (BAH); and provide service credit for time on active duty.

1297.last_action: Re-referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 9
1297.title: Relating To Judges.
1297.description: Changes the designation of judges of the intermediate appellate court, circuit courts, district courts, and family courts. Repeals the provision that allows the supreme court to summarily remove any district family judge from office and revoke the district family judge's commission whenever the supreme court deems such removal necessary for the public good or the volume of cases within the circuit is reduced to a level where the reduction of the number of district family judges within a circuit is deemed advisable.

1298.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 6
1298.title: Relating To Deceptive Trade Practices.
1298.description: Clarifies that any person that offers free or reduced rate shipping to a consumer in another state but who refuses to honor that shipping offer to a consumer in Hawaii has engaged in an act that is unfair and deceptive under certain conditions. Extends remedies.

1300.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 6
1300.title: Relating To Principal Departments.
1300.description: Establishes repeal dates for each principal department, preceded by an auditor review. Establishes procedures for department termination.

1301.last_action: Referred to EEP, LMG, FIN, referral sheet 6
1301.title: Relating To Renewable Energy Technologies Tax Credits.
1301.description: Amends the renewable energy technologies income tax credit to include commercial seawater air conditioning systems.

1302.last_action: Referred to PVM, JUD, referral sheet 6
1302.title: Related To Firearms.
1302.description: Defines "assault rifle" and "assault shotgun". Amends the definition of "assault pistol" to expand what types of guns are considered assault pistols. Expands the ban on pistols with a detachable magazine with over ten round capacity to any firearm with a detachable magazine with over ten round capacity.

1303.last_action: Referred to TIA, JUD, referral sheet 6
1303.title: Relating To Sentencing.
1303.description: Allows a defendant who has been convicted of three misdemeanors in Waikiki to be sentenced to a probationary term of geographic restriction not exceeding years during which the defendant shall be prohibited from entering Waikiki during the hours of 6:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. Imposes imprisonment of thirty days for violation.

1304.title: Relating To Mutual Assistance Agreement.
1304.description: Authorizes the State and electrical and gas utilities to enter into a mutual assistance agreement with an out-of-state utility to assist in the restoration of electrical or natural gas power following a natural disaster or emergency. (SD1)

1306.title: Relating To An Office Of Administrative Hearings.
1306.description: Requires the Legislative Reference Bureau (LRB) to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the existing administrative hearings process in the State and the potential for a centralized office of administrative hearings. Requires state departments and agencies to provide statistical, non-confidential information on contested case hearings to LRB. Requires LRB to research centralized administrative hearings offices in other jurisdictions. (HB1307 CD1)

1307.last_action: Referred to TIA/EEP, FIN, referral sheet 6
1307.title: Relating To Hawaii's Environment.
1307.description: Establishes the Promise to Our Keiki Program in the Hawaii Tourism Authority to protect Hawaii endangered animals and natural and cultural resources from the impacts of tourism by initiatives that include educational videos on inbound flights, requiring passengers on inbound flights to sign Promise to Our Keiki Pledge forms, and educational cards on airplanes.

1308.title: Relating To The Uniform Information Practices Act.
1308.description: Includes the nonadministrative functions of the Judiciary in the definition of "agency" for purposes of the Uniform Information Practices Act. Allows persons to bring actions or make appeals under the Uniform Information Practices Act directly in the Supreme Court. Allows agencies to appeal decisions of the Office of Information Practices to the Supreme Court.

1310.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1310.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Vi Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii To Amend The Manner In Which Justices And Judges Are Appointed, Consented To, And Retained.
1310.description: Proposes amendments to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii relating to the appointment and retention of justices and judges. Changes the required time frames from thirty to ninety days for the process to appoint and consent to a justice or judge. Harmonizes the senate consent procedures for district court judgeship nominees to mirror the senate consent procedures relating to supreme court justices and intermediate court of appeals and circuit court judges. Authorizes the senate to approve or reject subsequent terms of office for justices and judges.

1312.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 6
1312.title: Relating To Electronic Prescription Accountability System.
1312.description: Amends section 329-104(c), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to allow the Department of Public Safety Narcotics Enforcement Division Administrator to disclose, at the Administrator's discretion, confidential information from the Electronic Prescription Accountability System, more commonly known as the Prescription Drug Monitoring Program, to authorized employees of the Department of Health Alcohol and Drug Abuse Division and the Emergency Medical Services and Injury Prevention Systems Branch.

1313.last_action: Referred to LMG, WLH, FIN, referral sheet 6
1313.title: Relating To State Planning.
1313.description: Includes objectives and policies and implementation guidelines for planning for the lei of green in the Hawaii state plan.

1314.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Matsumoto, Okimoto voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Ward voting no (1) and Representative(s) Quinlan, Say, Thielen, Tokioka excused (4).
1314.title: Proposing Amendments To Article Ix, Section 5, Of The Constitution Of The State Of Hawaii.
1314.description: Proposes an amendment to article IX, section 5, of the Constitution of the State of Hawaii, to require the State to assure that each resident of the State has access to housing, subject to standards and criteria to be provided by the Legislature. (HB1315 HD1)

1315.last_action: Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1315.title: Relating To Condominium Voting.
1315.description: Provides for the use of an electronic voting device in condominium association meetings. Requires a condominium board to take reasonable steps to ensure secrecy and integrity of the votes, and that an audit trail be available after the meeting.

1317.last_action: Referred to LHE, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1317.title: Proposing An Amendment To The Hawaii Constitution To Transfer The Responsibility For The Provision Of Charter School Education From The State To The Counties.
1317.description: Proposes an amendment to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii to transfer the responsibility for the establishment, support, and control of charter schools from the State to the counties.

1318.title: Relating To Special Purpose Revenue Bonds For Electric Public Utilities.
1318.description: Authorizes special purpose revenue bonds for Hawaiian Electric Company, Inc. and its subsidiaries Maui Electric Company and Hawaii Electric Light Company for multi-project capital improvement programs. (HB1319 CD1)

1320.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on LMG with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Nakamura, Thielen excused (3).
1320.title: Relating To The Issuance Of Special Purpose Revenue Bonds To Assist Seawater Air Conditioning Projects On Oahu.
1320.description: Extends the authorization to issue special purpose revenue bonds to assist Honolulu Seawater Air Conditioning, LLC, with the development of a seawater air-conditioning system in downtown Honolulu until June 30, 2024. (HB1321 HD1)

1321.last_action: Referred to HSG, FIN, referral sheet 6
1321.title: Relating To Housing Production.
1321.description: Requires each county to authorize construction for a specified number of new housing units. Reduces the amount of transient accommodations tax revenue the counties receive for failure to meet the requirements. Allows for recoupment of reduction under certain circumstances. Repeals June 30, 2032.

1325.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
1325.title: Relating To Water Rights.
1325.description: Allows for ten consecutive one-year holdovers of water permits under section 171-58(c), HRS. Makes conforming amendments to the reporting requirement in Act 126 (2016). Extends the repeal and reenactment provision for Act 126 (2016) by seven years, from June 30, 2019 to June 30, 2026. (HB1326 HD2)

1327.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, DeCoite, Nakamura, Quinlan, Thielen excused (5).
1327.title: Relating To Government Websites.
1327.description: Requires that state and county websites be translated into the Hawaiian language. Appoints the Office of Planning to coordinate the translation. Appropriates funds. (HB1328 HD1)

1328.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 27th Representative District.

1334.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 42nd Representative District.

1348.description: Prohibits the Hawaii Community Development Authority from allowing satisfaction of a development project's affordable housing requirement through a cash payment in lieu of providing reserved housing. Effective 7/1/2075. (SD1)

1360.description: Prohibits pharmacy benefit managers from engaging in self-serving business practices. Replaces registration requirement with license requirement for pharmacy benefit managers. Increases pharmacy benefit manager reporting requirements to the insurance commissioner.

1361.description: Aligns the salary of the public utilities commission chair with the highest pay tier of a supervising deputy attorney general. Aligns the salary of the other PUC commissioners with the lowest pay tier of the first deputy attorney general.

1362.description: Establishes a study to identify issues that may arise if the State joins the Nurse Licensure Compact. (HB1363 HD2)

1365.title: Relating To The Department Of Health Budget.
1365.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Health for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (SD1)

1367.title: Relating To The Department Of Land And Natural Resources Operating Budget.
1367.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Land and Natural Resources operating budget. (SD1)

1368.description: Appropriates funds for the operating budget for the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021. (HB1369 HD1)

1369.last_action: Referred to EEP/TRN, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 6
1369.title: Relating To Zero-emission Vehicles.
1369.description: Requires rental motor vehicle lessors to incorporate zero-emission vehicles into their fleets. Creates a rental motor vehicle emissions surcharge tax on rental motor vehicles with internal combustion engines. Creates a Hawaii zero-emissions vehicle infrastructure special fund and grant program to promote development of zero-emission vehicle infrastructure.

1370.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 6
1370.title: Relating To The University Of Hawaii University Promise Program.
1370.description: Establishes the University of Hawaii University Promise Program to provide scholarships for the unmet direct cost needs of qualified students enrolled at any 4-year degree campus of the University of Hawaii system. Appropriates funds to establish and implement the program.

1371.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Thirteenth Representative District.
1371.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the 13th Representative District.

1372.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1372.title: Relating To The Hawaii Public Housing Authority Budget.
1372.description: Appropriates additional funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 to the Hawaii Public Housing Authority to establish new positions and for operating costs for Rental Housing Services (HMS 220) and Rental Assistance Services (HMS 222). Effective 1/1/2050. (SD1)

1540.description: Establishes the Hawaii Gun Violence Prevention Center within the University of Hawaii to research strategies to prevent gun violence. Creates a special fund to support the Center. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1542.last_action: The committee(s) on PVM recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1542.title: Relating To Gun Violence Protective Orders.
1542.description: Establishes a process allowing law enforcement officers and family or household members to obtain a court order to prevent a person from accessing firearms and ammunition where the person poses a danger of causing bodily injury to oneself or another.

1546.title: Making An Appropriation To The University Of Hawaii.
1546.description: Appropriates funds to the University of Hawaii for athletics. (HB1547 CD2)

1549.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Second Representative District.
1549.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 2nd Representative District.

1552.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1552.title: Relating To Homeland Security.
1552.description: Establishes the Hawaii State Fusion Center as a program under the Office of Homeland Security and establishes the state-funded position of Hawaii State Fusion Center Director to manage the Center's day-to-day operations and be accountable to the Director of Homeland Security. Effective 1/28/2081. (SD1)

1553.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
1553.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services Operating Budget.
1553.description: Relates to the Department of Human Services operating budget. Takes effect 7/1/2030. (SD1)

1554.title: Relating To Social Media.
1554.description: Establishes a task force to study the uses of social media platforms in the legislative process.

1556.title: Relating To Unoccupied Residential Properties.
1556.description: Imposes fines on a homeowner, foreclosing party, or prevailing purchaser in foreclosure actions when a vacant residential property subject to foreclosure remains unoccupied during the foreclosure process. Establishes conditions under which a property may be rented. (HB1557 HD1)

1558.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1558.title: Relating To The Kakaako Community Development District.
1558.description: Authorizes the HCDA to permit one building that is up to 768 feet in height and located near a transit station within each approved master plan area for the Kakaako Mauka area of the Kakaako Community Development District, subject to provision of appropriate public benefits. (HB1559 HD1)

1560.title: Relating To Agribusiness Development.
1560.description: Appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium 2019-2021 operating budget of the Agribusiness Development Corporation (ADC). Requires the Auditor to conduct a performance audit of the ADC. Appropriates funds for the Auditor to contract with an accounting firm to conduct a financial audit of the ADC. Requires the ADC to annually report and post on its website specified information. Appropriates funds for an environmental assessment and appraisal of certain real property. Effective 6/28/2019. (SD2)

1561.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 919).
1561.title: Relating To The Department Of Agriculture Operating Budget.
1561.description: Makes appropriations relating to the Department of Agriculture operating budget. (SD2)

1563.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1563.title: Relating To Coastal Zone Management.
1563.description: Establishes the Hawaii Beach Preservation Revolving Fund within the State Treasury. Establishes a low-interest Contingent Mortgage Financing Pilot Program to encourage certain shoreline property owners to relocate mauka of expected sea level rise and erosion hazard zones. Amends coastal zone management laws to further protect against impacts of sea level rise and coastal erosion. Appropriates funds. (HB1564 HD1)

1564.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Tenth Representative District.
1564.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 10th Representative District.

Kobayashi, McDermott, Ward, Yamane voting no (5) and Representative(s) Nakamura, Thielen excused (2).
1565.title: Relating To Prescriptive Authority For Certain Clinical Psychologists.
1565.description: Authorizes and establishes procedures and criteria for prescriptive authority for clinical psychologists who meet specific education, training, and registration requirements. Requires the Board of Psychology to report to the Legislature prior to the Regular Session of 2021. Sunsets on 8/31/2025. (HB1566 HD1)

1568.title: Relating To The Habitat Conservation Preserve.
1568.description: Requires the University of Hawaii to establish a habitat conservation preserve at its West Oahu campus.

1569.last_action: Referred to TRN/PVM, FIN, referral sheet 6
1569.title: Relating To Pedestrian Safety In Crosswalks.
1569.description: Requires the department of transportation to establish a policy that prioritizes improvements to crosswalks located in areas with frequent pedestrian injuries and fatalities and considers installing additional safety features.

1570.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Seventeenth Representative District.
1570.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 17th Representative District.

1571.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1571.title: Relating To The Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority.
1571.description: Establishes the Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority. Transfers jurisdiction and functions relating to commercial harbors and commercial maritime operations from the Department of Transportation to the Hawaii Commercial Harbors Authority. Appropriates funds.

1573.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Creagan, Gates, Okimoto, San Buenaventura, Tokioka, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, McDermott voting no (2) and Representative(s) Aquino, DeCoite, Nakamura, Quinlan, Thielen excused (5).
1573.title: Relating To Electronic Smoking Products.
1573.description: Establishes the offense of unlawful shipment of e-liquid products. Includes e-liquid within the definition of "tobacco products", as used in the cigarette tax and tobacco tax law. Increases the license fee for persons engaged as a wholesaler or dealer of cigarettes and tobacco products. Increases the retail tobacco permit fee for retailers engaged in the retail sale of cigarettes and tobacco products. Allocates a portion of collected excise taxes on tobacco products to the Tobacco Prevention and Control Trust Fund. Repeals certain provisions of the Hawaii Revised Statutes relating to electronic smoking devices. (HB1574 HD2)

1575.last_action: The committee(s) on EEP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1575.title: Relating To Solid Waste.
1575.description: Requires a retailer of certain batteries to implement a program in which the retailer accepts used batteries for reuse, recycling, or other means of disposal. Requires the Department of Health to expand its recycling operations to accommodate the recycling of batteries. Appropriates moneys.

1576.last_action: Referred to PVM/TRN, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1576.title: Relating To Detector-dogs.
1576.description: Appropriates funds for detector-dogs for the State's biosecurity program. Authorizes and funds a pilot program using dogs to detect fireworks in inbound cargo from state harbors and inter-island transport.

1578.last_action: Referred to EEP/EDB, CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1578.title: Relating To Statewide Sustainability Initiatives.
1578.description: Imposes a tax of $15 for every ton of carbon dioxide emitted from the use of fossil fuel. Establishes various state and county sustainability initiatives. Appropriates moneys.

1581.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 948).
1581.title: Relating To Concessions On Public Property.
1581.description: Increases the maximum length of concession contracts from 15 years to 20 years. Replaces requirements that certain concessions shall be operated by nonprofit corporations in order to be exempt from the sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, with a requirement that state and county agencies give preference to nonprofit corporations pursuant to rules. Provides that a county director of parks and recreation shall designate which county zoos, botanic gardens, or other county parks are environmentally, culturally, historically, or operationally unique for the purpose of determining whether a concession at the zoo, botanic garden, or other park is exempt from the sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes. Exempts from sealed bid requirements of section 102-2(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, concessions on public property whose operations provide historical and cultural information, goods, and services within the Hawaii Capital Historic District. Takes effect 7/1/2050. (SD2)

1583.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
1583.title: Relating To Carbon Emissions.
1583.description: Appropriates funds to the Office of Planning to conduct a comprehensive study of a statewide carbon tax. Effective 7/1/2100. (SD1)

1586.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Eighteenth Representative District.
1586.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 18th Representative District.

1588.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1588.title: Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Regarding The Election Of State Officials.
1588.description: Provides that if there are 2 or more candidates for a state public office, and a candidate receives the majority of votes for that office in the primary election, that candidate shall be elected. Provides that if none of the candidates receives a majority of votes cast in a primary election for a state public office, the 2 candidates who receive the highest number of votes for that office shall advance to a general election. Repeals constitutional requirements that a candidate for lieutenant governor be elected at the same time and on the same party ticket as a candidate for governor.

1589.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Forty-fifth Representative District.
1589.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 45th Representative District.

1590.title: Relating To Taxes.
1590.description: Eliminates the individual income tax for single filers and heads of households making less than $20,000 or joint filers making less than $40,000 and increases the income tax rate more slowly for low- and medium-income filers. Increases the general excise tax by 0.15 percent, the transient accommodations tax by 0.50 percent, the liquor tax, and the cigarette and tobacco tax.

2143.title: Relating To Digital Electronic Equipment.
2143.description: Requires original equipment manufacturers of digital electronic devices to make diagnostic and repair information available to device owners and independent repair providers.

2146.last_action: Vetoed on 07-09-19 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1381).
2146.title: Relating To Police Reports.
2146.description: Allows surviving immediate family members of murder or manslaughter victims to receive a copy of the closing report prepared by the investigating police department upon the conclusion of all criminal and civil proceedings that arose from the offense. (SB92 HD1)

2147.title: Relating To Mutual Benefit Societies.
2147.description: Requires the administrative board or body of a mutual benefit society to permit a special meeting to be called, upon the written request of not less than one thousand members of the society.

2149.title: Relating To Cancer Research.
2149.description: Appropriates funds to the UH Cancer Center to determine the reasons that Hawaii has the highest incidence of liver and bile duct cancer in the country.

2159.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Belatti, Yamane excused (2).
2159.title: Relating To Jury Duty.
2159.description: Clarifies that jurors are entitled to reimbursement for reasonable transportation costs to and from the court. Includes rail fare, bicycle rental, or taxi costs or other hired car service up to a specified maximum amount. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2160.last_action: The committee on CPH deferred the measure.
2160.title: Relating To Deferred Deposits.
2160.description: Reduces the maximum fee a check casher may charge under a payday loan agreement for deferring the deposit of a check from fifteen per cent to seven per cent of the face value of the check.

2162.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Seventeenth Senatorial District.
2162.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the seventeenth senatorial district.

2174.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2174.title: Relating To Speedy Trial.
2174.description: Creates a statutory right of victims and witnesses of sexual offenses under part V of chapter 707, HRS, to a speedy trial in criminal cases involving adult defendants. (SD1)

2185.title: Relating To Plastic Straws.
2185.description: Prohibits the distribution, sale, and provision of plastic straws. Establishes a fine for violators. Takes effect 1/1/2020.

2256.title: Relating To Professional And Vocational Regulatory Programs.
2256.description: Establishes repeal dates for all professional and vocational regulatory programs under the professional and vocational licensing division of the department of commerce and consumer affairs. Requires the auditor to perform an evaluation of each program prior to repeal.

2258.title: Relating To Real Estate.
2258.description: Exempts persons who are employees of real estate management divisions within companies or corporations incorporated, organized, or formed outside the State from the State's real estate license requirement provided that the employees may negotiate only up to five commercial leases and are duly licensed in their state of domicile.

2260.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2260.title: Related To Campaign Finance.
2260.description: Increases the amount of fines that may be assessed against a noncandidate committee for violations of organizational report requirements. Increases the amount of fines that may be assessed for violations of advertisement requirements. (SD1)

2266.last_action: The committee on HWN deferred the measure.
2266.title: Relating To Hawaiian Home Lands.
2266.description: Provides that a lessee of Hawaiian Homelands may use the value of the lease as collateral for a loan to build a dwelling on the tract of leased land; provided that a lender who does not qualify to be a lessee of Hawaiian Homes under this Act shall not become a lessee of the respective tract of land.

2274.title: Relating To Technology In Schools.
2274.description: Appropriates funds to further support technology in schools, as originally authorized in Act 168, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018.

2278.title: Relating To Special Number Plates.
2278.description: Adds the category of an atomic veteran to special number license plates.

2281.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Har, Okimoto, Tokioka voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Ward voting no (1) and Representative(s) Quinlan, Yamane excused (2).
2281.title: Relating To Immigration.
2281.description: Makes an appropriation to the Judiciary to contract with nonprofit organizations to provide legal assistance and legal counsel to immigrants in determining legal status and citizenship, provide diversion to existing services, and otherwise provide counsel for existing rights. (SB227 HD2)

2285.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Quinlan, Yamane excused (2).
2285.title: Relating To The Youth Commission.
2285.description: Establishes that the youth commission administrator shall administer the youth commission. Makes an appropriation to fund one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) permanent youth commission administrator position. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2286.title: Relating To Direct Primary Care Agreements.
2286.description: Enables patients and primary care providers to enter into direct primary care agreements to provide primary care services. Specifies that direct primary care agreements are not insurance and are not subject to the State's insurance code.

2290.title: Relating To Capital Improvement Projects For The Benefit Of The Twentieth Senatorial District.
2290.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the twentieth senatorial district.

2297.title: Relating To Payments Of Support.
2297.description: Includes tips or gratuities paid directly to an individual by a customer of the employer and reported or declared to the employer under the definition of income withheld by employers for payments of child or spousal support.

2300.title: Relating To Asset Forfeiture.
2300.description: Repeals the criminal forfeiture fund and requires fifty per cent of the total forfeited property and the sale proceeds thereof collected pursuant to state forfeiture laws to be deposited into the general fund.

2305.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on IAC/CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Belatti, Quinlan, Yamane excused (3).
2305.title: Relating To Sports Medicine.
2305.description: Provides a limited exemption from state licensure requirements to out-of-state physicians who accompany a sports team to a specific sporting event in Hawaii or are invited to provide services at a national sport training center, event, or competition in Hawaii, if certain conditions are met. Requires out-of-state physicians to provide notice to the Hawaii medical board. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2306.title: Relating To Automatic Restraining Orders.
2306.description: Clarifies that property may be disposed of if required for expenses for reasonable living accommodations. Allows disposal of real property if the disposal was pending prior to the filing for an annulment, divorce, or separation, with the proceeds of the disposal to be held in escrow until entry of the annulment, divorce, or separation decree.

2307.last_action: Referred to IAC, CPC, LMG, FIN, referral sheet 27
2307.title: Relating To Broadband Service.
2307.description: Codifies the substantive provisions of Executive Order No. 1802, which requires all state agencies to: contract internet-related services only with internet service providers that demonstrate and contractually agree to support and practice net neutrality principles where all internet traffic is treated equally; and add contract language and provisions to state procurement requirements that suppliers of telecommunications, internet, broadband, and data communication services shall abide by net neutrality principles. Defines "net neutrality principles". Requires DCCA director to monitor net neutrality including broadband and internet access services. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

2309.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC/WAM.
2309.title: Relating To Automated External Defibrillators.
2309.description: Requires by the end of the 2020-2021 school year that all public schools; public charter schools; and University of Hawaii and its divisions, campuses, and institutions have automated external defibrillators on campus. Requires the public schools; public charter schools; and University of Hawaii divisions, campuses, and institutions that have an athletic trainer to ensure that the athletic trainer is trained and certified in the use of an automated external defibrillator. Takes effect on 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2310.title: Relating To Student Informed Consent.
2310.description: Allows public school students in grades kindergarten through 12 to decline participation in dissection, vivisection, and other procedures harmful to animals. Requires schools to make alternative educational projects available, and the board of education to develop rules and give notice to all schools.

2311.title: Related To Renewable Energy.
2311.description: Requires the Public Utilities Commission to study and recommend how to implement a smart imports program in Hawaii. Requires electric utilities to offer excess electricity to consumers during daylight hours at cost for any legal purpose beginning 1/1/2021.

2312.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2312.title: Relating To Lead-based Paint.
2312.description: Prohibits the use of lead-based paint on outdoor structures after 12/31/20. (SD1)

2313.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2313.title: Relating To Offshore Drilling.
2313.description: Prohibits offshore drilling for oil or natural gas in state marine waters. Prohibits issuance of permits for or in connection with the development or operation of any facility or infrastructure associated with offshore drilling for oil or natural gas in state waters. Takes effect 12/31/2050. (SD1)

2316.title: Relating To Pueo Research.
2316.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Land and Natural Resources to conduct, in collaboration with the University of Hawaii College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources, a statewide breeding ecology study and foraging ecology study on the pueo.

2319.title: Relating To ulu.
2319.description: Appropriates funds for the research, development, marketing, and conservation of ulu.

2330.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Belatti, Cabanilla Arakawa, Holt, Tokioka, Yamane excused (5).
2330.title: Relating To The Department Of Public Safety.
2330.description: Appropriates funds and authorizes staff positions for the Women's Community Correctional Center Hookipa Makai Cottage. Appropriates funds for additional housing and transportation costs of certain inmates sent to Saguaro Correctional Center in Arizona. Relates to the Department of Public Safety budget and appropriates funds for adult corrections officers. (SB276 HD1)

2333.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2333.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services.
2333.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Human Services. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

2336.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2336.title: Relating To The Department Of Hawaiian Home Lands.
2336.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050.

2338.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2338.title: Relating To The Department Of Defense.
2338.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of Defense. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050.

2342.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2342.title: Relating To The Department Of The Attorney General.
2342.description: Appropriates funds for the Department of the Attorney General. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050.

2345.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.
2345.title: Relating To The Office Of Enterprise Technology Services.
2345.description: Appropriates funds for the Office of Enterprise Technology Services. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050.

2348.title: Relating To The Bernice Pauahi Bishop Museum.
2348.description: Appropriates funds to support the work of the Bernice Pauahi Bishop Museum.

2349.title: Relating To Government Records.
2349.description: Clarifies that a deliberative process privilege is consistent with the legislative intent of the uniform information practices act. Specifies that the confidential disclosure exception includes intra- and inter-agency memoranda and correspondence that qualify for the deliberative process privilege.

2364.title: Relating To The Earned Income Tax Credit.
2364.description: Changes the earned income tax credit from a nonrefundable tax credit to a refundable tax credit.

2372.last_action: Referred to LHE, FIN, referral sheet 27
2372.title: Making An Appropriation To The University Of Hawaii At Hilo.
2372.description: Appropriates funds for custodial and maintenance staff at the University of Hawaii at Hilo.

2373.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
2373.title: Relating To Capital Improvements For The University Of Hawaii.
2373.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the University of Hawaii.

2376.title: Proposing A Constitutional Amendment Relating To The Management And Conservation Of Resources.
2376.description: Proposes an amendment to article XI of the Hawaii State Constitution to include game animals on state lands as resources to be managed and conserved by the State and its political subdivisions.

2378.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2378.title: Relating To Wildlife Resources.
2378.description: Requires the department of land and natural resources to employ cooperative resource management strategies in the management and administration of the wildlife and wildlife resources of the State. Takes effect 12/31/2050. (SD1)

2393.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
2393.title: Relating To Improvements At Waipahu High School.
2393.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for Waipahu high school. (SD1)

2395.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 918).
2395.title: Related To The Practice Of Behavior Analysis.
2395.description: Clarifies exemptions from licensure as a behavioral analyst for general education teachers, direct support workers, special education teachers, and teacher trainees working in collaboration with or under the supervision of licensed professionals. Requires the DOE to seek approval by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to amend the Hawaii Medicaid State Plan to provide reimbursement for applied behavior analysis services. (SB341 HD2)

2399.title: Relating To Highway Patrol.
2399.description: Establishes a state highway patrol within the Sheriff Division of the Department of Public Safety. Appropriates moneys.

2401.title: Relating To The President Of The University Of Hawaii.
2401.description: Prohibits the President of the University of Hawaii from serving concurrently as a campus chancellor.

2406.title: Relating To Bottled Water.
2406.description: Prohibits the sale or distribution of bottled water on state owned lands beginning 10/1/2019. Prohibits the sale or distribution of bottled water by permitted food trucks beginning 10/1/2020. Prohibits the sale or distribution of bottled water in the State beginning 12/31/2021. Prohibits the use of state funds to purchase bottled water. Provides for waivers and exclusions. Imposes civil penalties for violation. Establishes state policy on public water and bottled water.

2409.title: Related To Civil Forfeiture.
2409.description: Requires a nine-month holding period before disposition of forfeited property by the attorney general.
